data.title: Screen Scrolls Down Whenever I Begin Typing, Only When Using Java
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.13.1
- OS Version: Unbuntu 16.04

Steps to Reproduce:

1. When I type a key, the screen scrolls down (opened up a new window, same issue)
2. It will not scroll down again until I stop typing for half a second and then continue (generalized time period)
3. Only occurs if using Java, never had it happen with Ruby, HTML, CSS or JavaScipt, 

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: onDidTerminateDebugSession maybe shouldn't fire when debug session doesn't start successfully
data.body:
Testing #29490

If a call to `createDebugSession` fails, e.g. for passing invalid arguments, `onDidTerminateDebugSession` is still fired. It seems like maybe it shouldn't fire in that case. I don't know whether there are other events in the extension API that follow a similar pattern that we can follow.

data.title: Esc from Find widget only returns focus to terminal for edit box
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.14 Insiders
- OS Version: Windows 7

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open Find widget leaving focus on edit box
2. Press Esc

Focus returns to the Integrated Terminal.

3. Now open Find widget and use arrow ~~keys~~buttons
4. Press Esc

Esc has no effect. If you return to the edit box, Esc does close the Find widget and returns focus to the terminal.

1. Open the Find widget 
2. Close Find widget with mouse on X

Focus is gone from Integrated Terminal.

data.title: Make split editor more useful (3 UX issues)
data.body:
1. Allow multiple key bindings for split editor functionality (see screenshot)
2. Key bindings should always "reset" horizontal space, evenly separating windows*
3. New panes should be empty*

*When a user drags one pane to make it larger than the others (as in the screenshot), then selects _any_ of their split pane shortcut combos, ensure that the horizontal space is reverted to an evenly distributed amount. In the case of the screenshot, `alt+shift+3` would ensure the horizontal spacing is reverted to 1/3, 1/3, 1/3.

*It's confusing that when a splits pane is automatically populated with code. Why? In the screenshot, I have the same file open in three panes. In Sublime, I often split the editor in two, then drag a config file (or readme, etc.) on to the _empty_ pane. In VSCode, I first have to close the file that's been duplicated (for some odd reason) in the new pane(s).

![split-panes](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1389303/27602943-1f21d80e-5b3a-11e7-8e8f-8e293f3bfe24.png)
.

data.title: Allow configuration of how go-to definition navigation behaves
data.body: It seems that go-to definition navigation will replace the current tab. If the tab has an edited/unsaved file it will open a new tab. It would be great if we could configure this default behavior. Personally I'd much prefer to always open a new tab regardless if the source file is edited or not.

data.title: Extension is working at debug but not after be installed as vsix
data.body:
After update my VSCode to 1.13.1, the pkosta2006.angular-cli extension that I used to use just stopped to work. I just can see the commands it provides. But clicking on any of them doesn't do anything, not even an error is being shown in console.

In order to investigate I've cloned its source code and tried to debug it. 

Interestingly, it worked while in debug mode. I was able to call its commands and see the result.

So I changed its version and exporting it using VSCE package. Then I installed its VSIX file into VSCODE workspace, but the problem persisted.

data.title: Debounce with 'leading' set should not fire twice for a single input event
data.body: Discussion: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/commit/f1abc274df165aea3fd83720f7ff6a9c4bb8c8cd#commitcomment-22787803

data.title: Multiroot change event should have a delta
data.body: The `onDidChangeWorkspaceFolders` should carry a delta of what as changed such that extensions have an easier time with book-keeping. Related to https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/28526

data.title: "editor.lineNumbers" not respected in mutli folder setup
data.body:
Tests https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/29466

- two folders both having editor.lineNumbers set to off
- open workspace with both folders
- enable the setting in both folders

Observe: nothing happens. The editor doesn't render any line numbers.

data.title: [scss] Red bracket in sass selector preview
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.13.1 (379d2efb5539b09112c793d3d9a413017d736f89, 2017-06-14T18:21:47.485Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|python|donjayamanne|0.6.5|
|vscode-html-css|ecmel|0.1.7|
|prettify-json|mohsen1|0.0.3|
|sass-indented|robinbentley|1.4.1|
|vscode-sass-format|sasa|1.1.0|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Paste this code into a `.scss` file
```
.embedded {
    .before {
       &:before {
            color:red;
       }
    }
}
```

2. Hover over `&:before`
See this: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9338938/27598357-38a93ac6-5b33-11e7-93e7-91df7f5a0b9a.png)

3. Wonder what the red bracket is for.


---

I checked in my co-worker's vs code, (1.12.1) and he did not have the highlight. 
He updated to 1.13.1 and now has the highlight.

Verified on Windows 7, 10 and Mac on 1.13.1

I asked a SO question as well, but it didn't gain much traction, and it didn't seem to be a good fit considering the lack of documentation 
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/44784718

data.title: proposed API breaks hello world extension
data.body:
testing #29466:

- use `yo code` to create typescript extension "hello-world"
- open in VS Code
- F5

Observe: compiles and runs fine (but error #29581 shows up in debug console)

- add `"enableProposedApi": true,` to package.json
- create folder "typings" in "src"
- copy "vscode.proposed.d.ts" from vscode workspace into "typings"
- open extension.ts or vscode.proposed.d.ts

Observe: now both have lots of undefined types:

![2017-06-27_18-29-07](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1898161/27598688-8c901e10-5b66-11e7-83df-8abdbb40b3e1.png)

The same "vscode.proposed.d.ts" works fine in an extension "hello-world" that has been generated some time ago (and uses older versions of the npm modules).
